title: Bug 38131 - ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: Currently, when compiling the class using ajc, a new directory with the same name as the subpackage is created under the existing subpackage directory, causing duplication of the directory structure.
EB: When compiling the class using ajc, the compiled .class file should be placed in the correct subpackage directory.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Compile the class using ajc -d option and specify the path to the subpackage directory and the path to the Java file.
